summary: This document is an email chain between FBI personnel discussing a tip from retired FBI agent Jeffrey Carrie. On August 16, 2019, Carrie overheard a conversation at a bar in New Jersey where a woman made claims about Jeffrey Epstein's death, including money sent to a Swiss bank account and alleged involvement of four BOP employees. The email includes photos of the woman and her license plate for investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Carrie
persons.role: Former FBI Agent, Director of Security & Emergency Management at Weill Cornell Medical Center
persons.context: A retired FBI agent who overheard a conversation about the Epstein case at a bar and reported it to the FBI, providing photos of the individuals involved.

persons.name: Diego
persons.role: Employer of Jeffrey Carrie at NYP
persons.context: Mentioned as the person Jeffrey Carrie now works for at NYP (likely NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital).

connections.description: Jeffrey Carrie works for Diego at NYP (NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital).
Carrie overheard the woman discussing the Epstein case and took photos of her as she left the bar.

events.title: Conversation Overheard at De Novo Bar
events.description: Jeffrey Carrie overheard two women discussing the Epstein case at the De Novo Bar in Montclair, NJ. One woman made claims about money sent to a Swiss bank account after Epstein's death and alleged involvement of four BOP employees.

events.title: Email Report to FBI
events.description: Jeffrey Carrie sent an email to the FBI reporting the overheard conversation and attached photos of the women involved.

events.title: FBI Internal Email Chain
events.description: FBI personnel forwarded and discussed Jeffrey Carrie's tip internally, noting his background and the need to vet the information for connections to the case.

keyFacts: A retired FBI agent overheard a conversation on August 16, 2019, where a woman claimed money was sent to a Swiss bank account after Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The woman also alleged that four Bureau of Prisons (BOP) employees were involved and could retire within the next year.
She criticized the handling of Epstein's incarceration, including moving his cellmate and correctional officers not performing proper checks.
The retired agent took photos of the woman and her license plate, which were forwarded to the FBI for investigation.
The email chain shows the FBI actively vetting tips and potential leads related to Epstein's death and the surrounding circumstances.
